bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard to Edwin F. Uhl, October 28, 1895
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate Series
Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, Oct. 28, 1895.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. NOV 25 1895 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
Subject:
Inventory of Mr. John Harris' property.
Consulate series
Consulate-General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, Oct. 28/95.
Hon.Edwin F, Uhl, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington D. C.
Sir: I have the honor to enclose inventory of the estate of the late John Harris of Dallas Texas. I proceed to settle the estate as promptly as possible.
I am obediently William H. Heard Min. Res. and Con. Gen.
Enclosures 2
1. Inventory of stock in store 2. ,, ,, personal effects
